did.unittitle: University of California, Los Angeles. Office of the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Business records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. Office of the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Business

did.abstract: This record series contains materials created by the Office of the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Business, including correspondence, annual reports, audit materials, staff and committee meeting minutes and agendas, and administrative files.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright to portions of this collection has been assigned to UCLA Library Special Collections. The library can grant permission to publish for materials to which it holds the copyright. Commercial use may require additional rights that must be determined and obtained by the researcher. All requests for copyright permission to publish must be submitted in writing to Library Special Collections. Credit shall be given as follows: The Regents of the University of California on behalf of the UCLA Library Special Collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Office of the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Business, 1992.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], University of California, Los Angeles. Office of the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Business records (University Archives Record Series 458). UCLA Library Special Collections, University Archives, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by University Archives staff in 1992 February; further processing by Katharine A. Lawrie in 2013; revisions by Julianna Jenkins in 2017. Reprocessed by Lori Dedeyan in 2020. Final processing by Kelly Besser, 2024.

Reprocessing included merging the contents of this record series with other records of the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Business, formerly contained in Record Series 463 (Correspondence files, processed in 1992),and Record Series 464 (Agendas, minutes, and reports of staff meetings,formerly unprocessed). Those record series numbers have now been retired. Materials that do not fall within the scope of the UC Records Retention Schedule have been removed.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Administrative/ Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Office of the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Business was created in 1974, serving within the portfolio of the Vice Chancellor for Administration. The Assistant Vice Chancellor was responsible for the oversight of campus Business Services, Extramural Support, Material Management, Communications and Transportation Services, and Housing and Food Services. The position was first occupied by Harland B. Thompson, who generated most of the materials in this record series.

The Administrative Services Division included the Accounting Office, Affirmative Action Office, Campus Architects and Engineers, Cashier's Office, Central Stenography, Environmental Health and Safety, Facilities and Operations, Inventory, Mail and Messenger Service, Office Extramural Support, Personnel Office, Police Department, and Purchasing and Receiving.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This record series contains materials created by the Office of the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Business, including correspondence, annual reports, audit materials, staff and committee meeting minutes and agendas, and administrative files. This includes documentation of staff meetings, task forces, campus councils, and professional organizations, such as the Administrative Affairs Council, Business Affairs Council, Capitol Affairs Council, Disability Compliance Task Force, National Association of College and University Business Officers, Policy committee on Sales and Service Activities and Service Enterprise, the Expanded Management Group, Regents' meetings, and others. Also included are administrative files relating to major campus construction projects and long range development plans, facilities and space leasing, audits, transitions to new software and management systems, budgets and financial planning, affirmative action plans, employee relations and union negotiations, and major events such as the 1984 Olympics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection has been arranged in the following series:
Series 1. Correspondence
Series 2. Annual reports
Series 3. Meeting minutes and agendas
Subseries 3.1. Staff meetings
Subseries 3.2. Committees, councils, and task forces
Series 4. Administrative files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains outgoing correspondence generated by the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Business. Subjects of correspondence are consistent with the issues and projects detailed in the administrative files.

Subjects of note include the University Policies Commission Task Force on Campus Violence; Federal Anti-Riot Legislation; the creation of the Campus Activities Service Office; the Experimental Police Student Relations Program; the Campus ID system; University property acquisitions and leases; campus housing; the Regents' Action on Campus Emergencies; Campus Disturbance Reports outlining protests, marches, and sit-ins; news of the Kent State massacre; affirmative action and "minority recruitment;" Committee on Campus Press and the TV-Motion Picture Media Production Committee, Chancellor's Cabinet and Division Head meeting minutes, and the Campus Emergency Plan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the annual reports of the UCLA Business Operations Division.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains meeting agendas, minutes, notes, and other documentation for staff meetings and the meetings of various committees, councils, and task forces.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series has been arranged into two subseries: Staff meetings and Committees, councils, and task forces.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes meeting agendas, action summaries, minutes and notes, and distributed materials for various offices within the Business Operations Division.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include budgetary review for the fiscal year; the campus energy crisis (steps to conserve energy by campus), EPA California Transportation Control Plan, CAL/OSHA regulations, parking and transportation, physical plant management and holiday policy, salaries and cost of living increases, and Task Force on Energy Distribution. During this time, the Vice Chancellor's office was also responsible for the Staff Affirmative Action Program. This included oversight of staff Affirmative Action Compliance Committee and Staff Affirmative Action Office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include the staff affirmative action program, parking allocations, Public Service Employment Program, annual reports and financial reviews, UCLA Child Care Center, parking and transportation, the Fiscal Analysis Data System (FADS), space needs and assessments, the student housing building program, facilities management, and staff retreats.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include departmental administration, budgets, annual reports, the Chancellor's Advisory Committee on the Status of Women (CACSW), the Administrative Information Systems taskforce, Administrative Affairs Council, Management Development Program, and communications systems policies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include the department's Organization and Functions Manual, Management Effectiveness Program, Business Operations Division budget expenditure report, Management Personnel Evaluation Form, UC Vehicle Purchase policy, Prop 13, campus budget cuts, budget summary for the Vice Chancellor's office, the campus hiring freeze, and internal audits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include student employment, telecommunications, administrative reports and operating budgets for the Vice Chancellor's office, the campus internal audit program for business operations, Management Training Program- student services and development division, managerial evaluations, visitor and special parking fees, Affirmative Action program, faculty housing, Prop 13 and budget reductions, and the Vice Chancellor's executive review.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include the University Staff Compensation Committee report, the Higher Education Employer-Employee Relations Act (HEERA), campus space issues, Regents' Working Capital Fund, departmental operating budgets and audits, 1984 Olympics planning, staff affirmative action program, new campus financial system, campus site planning, and cost accounting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include administrative reports, budgetary issues, the departmental grant program, student housing on campus, the South Campus Master Plan, the memorandum of understanding between the 1984 Los Angeles Olympics Organizing Committee and UCLA, Costing and Working Capital for Auxiliary and Service Enterprises, data processing projects, the campus hiring freeze, and legislative budget hearings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include the campus hiring freeze (Executive Order B97-82), Facilities Management Deferred Maintenance Program, Systemwide Administration cost reallocation to campus teaching hospitals, Costing and Working Capital for Auxiliary and Service Enterprises, student housing, administrative reports and budgetary issues, a California Educational Television (KCET)/UCLA agreement, and the Westwood Central Plaza/ BruinWalk project. Also included are materials concerning collective bargaining on campus, such as the "UCLA Actions to Resolve Collective Bargaining-Related Problems With Systemwide Administration" report, administrative review and grievances analysis, sample memos encouraging employees to vote for no union representation, and other policy and analysis documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include the 1984 Olympics, administrative reports and budgetary issues, new computer systems, Business Operations Division Expanded Management Group, and the campus master audit plan. Also included are materials related to collective bargaining on campus, such as mailings and bulletins encouraging staff to vote no on union representation, the Bargaining Policy Council, the "Collective Bargaining in the University" conference, information about various unions, collective bargaining training sessions, and nominees and selections for bargaining teams.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include administrative reports and budgetary issues, the 1984 Olympics, collective bargaining and grievance procedures, American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees (AFSCME) agreements, facilities and operations, parking and transportation long-range planning, management seminars, the campus audit program, the Business Operations Division annual report, child care services, and the Department of Defense conference at UCLA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include management seminars, union negotiations and collective bargaining materials, budget issues and administrative reports, the West Campus Management Plan, transportation planning, campus facilities and operations, and campus child care services.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include Expanded Management Group activities, management workshops and seminars, budgets, UCLA Technology Transfer Program proposals, salary increases, AFSCME salary negotiations, audits, construction projects, the Chancellors' Conference on Affirmative Action, and the UCLA seismic correction program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include staff affirmative action programs, budget reports, administrative reports, campus child care services, a Summary of Facilities Requirements, Business Operations department activities, merit increases, and management workshops.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subjects of meetings include staff affirmative action programs, Expanded Management Group activities, the Executive Budget Committee, and budgetary and administrative issues.

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, notes, reports, budgets, management plans, campus administrative issues projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes meeting minutes, notes, and agendas for various committees, councils, task forces, and working groups.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged alphabetically by group title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Action Plans, Evaluation of Access draft report, and Facility Survey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes correspondence, minutes and notes, reports and proposals, budgets and financial materials, and other documentation relating to various campus activities and projects.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged alphabetically by subject.
